timeline.bodyText: I'd add some commentary about the purpose.  Something about the scope (per agent) and purpose (to thwart external gaming of the random comparison).
timeline.author: shemnon

timeline.bodyText: Randomly feels like the wrong name.  While the mask is random once it's set it doesn't change. compareByMaskedNodeId?
timeline.author: shemnon

replies.bodyText: Yeah, I felt similarly when writing it. I like your suggestion.
replies.author: RatanRSur

timeline.bodyText:
Perhaps we should white box this test.
Go ahead and set up the pool and the peer randomly, but then get the peer that would be evicted (sorted last), then generate peers until we get one that we see is higher priority than the one to be evicted, and then only once do the add check loop.  We would need to get at the peers list and the nodeIdMask to do this, hence the white boxing.
timeline.author: shemnon

replies.bodyText: We also need a test case where the new node doesn't get added because it's going to sort below all the other nodes.  So we need another test with the same white box setup but instead we search for a node that will rank below all other nodes.
replies.author: shemnon

replies.bodyText: Is the only reason to make the test deterministic?
replies.author: RatanRSur

replies.bodyText: If that's the only benefit, I think I prefer black boxing it because I've run into a lot of problems with changing code that has very whiteboxed testing in p2p. With the number of iterations we do here and the number of remote connections (1), this is an intermittent test with a very very low probability of failing.
replies.author: RatanRSur

replies.bodyText: If we are going to black box it we still need to detect connection accepted and connection rejected.
replies.author: shemnon
